data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Allergic Shock
attacks.text: During your next turn, if the Defending Pokémon is damaged by an attack, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Weedle and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grass Knot
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Sceptile
data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

abilities.name: Nurture and Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Grovyle
data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Sceptile
data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Poison
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy attached to this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Lombre
data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Lotad
data.flavorText: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

abilities.name: Captivating Rhythm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Solar Ray
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction–to and fro and sideways.

attacks.name: Spiral Gyration
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Shroomish
data.flavorText: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Breloom
data.flavorText: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Volbeat
data.flavorText: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Illumise
data.flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Twirling Sign
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Trevenant-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Forest
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wood Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

abilities.name: Barrier Shrine
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

attacks.name: Grass Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Indomitable Blaze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flare Bonus
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Camerupt-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Jet
attacks.text: Discard as many Fire Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

data.name: Combusken
data.flavorText: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Blaziken
data.flavorText: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.

attacks.name: Spreading Flames
attacks.text: Attach 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Heat Blow
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.

attacks.name: Knockout Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Marshtomp
data.flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Swampert
data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

abilities.name: Diving Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Swampert
data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ludicolo
data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery
ancientTrait.text: When this Pokémon is healed, double the amount healed.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Splash Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Splash Dance attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Wailord-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Water Veil
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.

attacks.name: High Breaching
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.

data.name: Whiscash
data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Whiscash
data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Corphish
data.flavorText: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Milotic
data.flavorText: It is the world's most beautiful Pokémon. There are many works of art featuring Milotic.

abilities.name: Sparkling Ripples
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Swirl
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Feebas
data.flavorText: It is the shabbiest Pokémon of all. It forms in schools and lives at the bottom of rivers.

attacks.name: Float On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: Be it Spheal or a Poké Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: Its body is covered in fluffy fur. The fur keeps it from feeling cold while it is rolling on ice.

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy, they clap fins.

data.name: Walrein
data.flavorText: It shatters drift ice with its strong tusks. Its thick layer of blubber repels enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Frozen Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Clamperl
data.flavorText: It is protected by a sturdy shell. Once in a lifetime, it makes a magnificent pearl.

attacks.name: Shell Protection
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 50 or less.

data.name: Huntail
data.flavorText: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: A mythical Pokémon said to have swelled the seas with rain and tidal waves. It battled with Groudon.

attacks.name: Spring Tides
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Ocean Cyclone
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Whirlpool
attacks.text: Return 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon to your hand.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Gorebyss
data.flavorText: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Gorebyss
data.flavorText: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Primal Kyogre-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Kyogre-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Tidal Storm
attacks.text: Move 2 Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Manaphy
data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Sea Swirl
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Life Saver
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Manectric
data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Lightning Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Electrike
data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Electrike
data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

attacks.name: Buzz Flip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electricannon
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery
ancientTrait.text: When this Pokémon is healed, double the amount healed.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: Small and very docile, it protects itself with its small, poisonous horn when attacked.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: The body is covered by stiff, needle-like scales. If it becomes excited, the needles bristle outwards.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: The body is covered by stiff, needle-like scales. If it becomes excited, the needles bristle outwards.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself. Don't apply Weakness to this damage.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

attacks.name: Synchro Star
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.

attacks.name: Dancing Tentacles
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.

attacks.name: Lost in the Waves
attacks.text: Return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery
ancientTrait.text: When this Pokémon is healed, double the amount healed.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

attacks.name: Rock Shower
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rock Wall
abilities.text: Any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Nosepass
data.flavorText: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Meditite
data.flavorText: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.

attacks.name: Solar Generator
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Special Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Yoga Kick
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Trapinch
data.flavorText: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

data.name: Medicham
data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Windmill Kick
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Groudon
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Primal Groudon-EX
rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Groudon-EX, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrier
ancientTrait.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Trainer card (excluding Pokémon Tools and Stadium cards), prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Volcano
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.flavorText: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

attacks.name: Resistance Desert
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Sharpedo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jagged Fang
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. Then, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Crawdaunt
data.flavorText: Loving to battle, this Pokémon pinches all Pokémon that enter its territory with its pincers and throws them out.

abilities.name: Unruly Claw
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Aggron-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Steel Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Diggersby
data.flavorText: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

attacks.name: Ear Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: M Aggron-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Megaton Slam
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 120 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Probopass
data.flavorText: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Reinforced Nose
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dredge
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Doublade
data.flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Azumarill
data.flavorText: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery
ancientTrait.text: When this Pokémon is healed, double the amount healed.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Straight Claw
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Honedge
data.flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Aegislash
data.flavorText: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

abilities.name: Miracle Guard
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Protect Charge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.

attacks.name: Trick
attacks.text: Move a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of either player's Pokémon to another of that player's Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If there is no Pokémon to move the Pokémon Tool card to, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Marill
data.flavorText: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

data.name: Gardevoir-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Life Leap
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Wind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Gather Strength
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy and a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: M Gardevoir-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Fairy Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life forms can survive.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Vibrava
data.flavorText: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Flygon
data.flavorText: Known as "The Desert Spirit," this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

abilities.name: Sand Flap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose either player. That player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Zigzagoon
data.flavorText: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Linoone
data.flavorText: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Delcatty
data.flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Spinda
data.flavorText: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.

attacks.name: Staggering Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery
ancientTrait.text: When this Pokémon is healed, double the amount healed.

attacks.name: Drench
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Bibarel
data.flavorText: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.flavorText: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 40 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Aggron Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Aggron-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Archie's Ace in the Hole
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Put a Water Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Bunnelby
data.flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

ancientTrait.name: Ω Barrage
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may attack twice a turn. (If the first attack Knocks Out your opponent's Active Pokémon, you may attack again after your opponent chooses a new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardevoir Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gardevoir-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Dive Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Fresh Water Set
rules: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Groudon Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes Primal Groudon-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kyogre Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes Primal Kyogre-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Maxie's Hidden Ball Trick
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Put a Fighting Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Birch's Observations
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck and flip a coin. If heads, draw 7 cards. If tails, draw 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Repeat Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with the same name as 1 of your Pokémon in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rough Seas
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may heal 30 damage from each of his or her Water Pokémon and Lightning Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Scorched Earth
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Fire or Fighting Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does so, he or she draws 2 cards.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Shrine of Memories
rules: Each player's evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (That player still needs the necessary Energy to use each attack.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Teammates
rules: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.
Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Silent Lab
rules: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Shield Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Metal Pokémon. This card provides Metal Energy only while this card is attached to a Metal Pokémon.
The attacks of your opponent's Pokémon do 10 less damage to the Metal Pokémon this card is attached to (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Metal Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Trevenant-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Forest
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wood Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Wailord-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Water Veil
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.

attacks.name: High Breaching
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

rules: Primal Reversion rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes Primal Kyogre-EX, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Tidal Storm
attacks.text: Move 2 Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

rules: Discard a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Wonder Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Fairy Pokémon. This card provides Fairy Energy only while this card is attached to a Fairy Pokémon.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to the Fairy Pokémon that this card is attached to. (Existing effects are not removed.)
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fairy Pokémon, discard this card.)
